intro: Euphrasia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It has small, opposite leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are often clustered in whorls along the stems. Euphrasia parviflora is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used to treat eye conditions and other ailments.
